gw.api.tools

Class ClusterInfoData

  • java.lang.Object
    • gw.api.tools.ClusterInfoData

  • public class ClusterInfoData
extends java.lang.Object
    Helper object for Cluser Info page. Note that many of these methods try to contact batch server and wait for response with significant timeout. Do not use these method on non-admin pages because they can slow them down significantly.

      • isClusteringEnabled

        public static boolean isClusteringEnabled()

      • isBatchServerAvailable

        public static boolean isBatchServerAvailable()
        Loads the information about current batch server from the database and pings the batch server. DO NOT USE THIS METHOD ON NON-ADMIN PAGES.. This method tries to contact batch server and waits for response with significant timeout.
        Returns:
        true if batch server is running

        Returns:

      • getAllServers

        public java.util.List<ClusteredServer> getAllServers()
        Returns information about all servers (nodes with distinct serverIDs) forming the cluster. Note that some servers may be currently stopped (or fell out of the cluster for some reason), in this case ClusteredServer.isInCluster() will return false.
        Returns:
        information about all servers forming the cluster.

      • getRunningServers

        public java.util.List<ClusteredServer> getRunningServers()
        Returns the list of members of current JGroups cluster. This method uses the following algorithm:
        • Retrieve the list of members' addresses from the channel itself - this is the up to date state of the cluster from the server point of view
        • For each address: find the detailed information about this member in the database
        Returns:
        cluster member list .

      • getPotentialClusterMembers

        public java.util.List<ClusteredServer> getPotentialClusterMembers()
        Returns the list of potential members of the cluster. Potential members are "potentially running" nodes which are NOT in the current cluster. The node is considered a "potentially running" if its "last update" timestamp (field in the cluster member table) is within getStaleRecordTimeout() milliseconds of the current time. Note that JGroups MERGE2 protocol uses the same list to discover subgroups which may be formed due to network partition.
        Returns:
        list of potential members of the cluster.

      • getHistory

        public java.util.List<ClusterMemberData> getHistory(java.lang.String serverId,
                                           int max)
        Returns latest history of runs for the given server id.
        Parameters:
        serverId - server id
        max - max size of the returned list
        Returns:
        list of runs sorted by date descendingly

      • getHistoryQuery

        public com.guidewire.pl.system.database.Query<ClusterMemberData> getHistoryQuery(java.lang.String serverId)
        This method is created specially for ClusterInfo page to serve pageable server history list view.
        Parameters:
        serverId - server id
        Returns:
        query that is decorated by the LV to provide paging capabilities

      • downloadSummaryReport

        public void downloadSummaryReport(int maxHistoryRecords)
        Downloads clustering summary state report.
        Parameters:
        maxHistoryRecords - maximum number of "History of Runs" records for each server. If 0 or less "History of Runs" section will not be included in the report.

        public boolean isDatabaseDiscoveryUsed()
